Patent Information.Patent Title: Disease treatment via antimicrobial peptides or their inhibitors.
Patent Information.Abstract: The invention provides methods for the treatment of disease and promotion of healing that include providing a therapeutically effective amount of a mammalian antimicrobial peptide (AMP) or analog thereof, in particular a cathelicidin or cathelicidin fragment or cathelicidin analog, thereby treating the disease in the subject in need thereof. The invention also provides specific analogs or fragments of cathelicidin that function as agonists, as do endogenous cathelicidins, or as either dominant negatives or as inhibitors to endogenous cathelicidin or to other endogenous AMPs or that compete with pro-inflammatory agents or fragments of AMPs on cognate receptors without inducing disease.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.31226350] Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=1-2 μM);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli (MIC=2-4 μM)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.31226350] 50% hemolysis at 75 μM for human red blood cells
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: [Ref.31226350] The CC50 values which represent peptide concentration (μM) inducing 50% cytotoxicity to human cancer cell lines of BMAP-27 on MDA361 and A549 are 4.2 μM and 5.3 μM.  DETAILED DATA:①The cell viability of MDA-361 induced by BMAP-27 is 100%, 100%, 98.9%, 97.7%, 87.6%, 59.8%, 34.7%, 12.4%, 10.3%, 8.3% and 9.4% at peptide concentrations of 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.8, 1.6, 3.2, 6.4, 13, 25, 50 and 100 μM. ②The cell viability of A549 induced by BMAP-27 is 100%, 99.1%, 97.7%, 94.7%, 74.5%, 41.4%, 24.4%, 11.3%, 9.7%, 10.3% and 7.4% at peptide concentrations of 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.8, 1.6, 3.2, 6.4, 13, 25, 50 and 100 μM.
Sequence Information.Structure Description: An α-helix occurred from Arg2 to Leu17 in the N-terminal region and a short α-helix is observed from Leu23 to Leu26 in the Cterminal region; the two regions are connected with a flexible region containing two proline residues.
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against Gram-positive bacteria and Gram-negative bacteria.

Literature.Title: Structural analysis and mode of action of BMAP-27, a cathelicidin-derived antimicrobial peptide
Literature.Author: Yang S, Lee CW, Kim HJ, Jung HH, Kim JI, Shin SY, Shin SH
